feat_req__config_mgmt__term_parameter_se.title: Term definition of Parameter Set

feat_req__daal__com.content: The communication layer should use the IPC Framework
feat_req__daal__com.title: Communication

feat_req__daal__env.content: It should be possible to use the framework with all specified os like qnx and linux
feat_req__daal__env.title: Execution Environments

feat_req__daal__health_error.content: Error and Health Management should be availability
feat_req__daal__health_error.title: Health & Error Management

feat_req__daal__lifecycle.content: Lifecycle of executables should use one generic API
feat_req__daal__lifecycle.title: Lifecycle Interface

feat_req__daal__log.content: Core Logging API should be used
feat_req__daal__log.title: Logging

feat_req__daal__time_based_arch.content: The daal framework shall provide Trigger to support a time-based architecture.
feat_req__daal__time_based_arch.title: Support for Time-based Architecture

feat_req__daal__trigger.content: Singe Shot and Cyclic execution should be possible
feat_req__daal__trigger.title: Trigger

feat_req__diagnostics__classic_adapter.content: The system shall include a classic diagnostic adapter to translate SOVD requests into UDS commands.
feat_req__diagnostics__classic_adapter.title: Classic Diagnostic Adapter

feat_req__diagnostics__classic_adapter_o.content: The classic diagnostic adapter shall support configuration via ODX files that describe the UDS command mappings and behavior per ECU.
feat_req__diagnostics__classic_adapter_o.title: Classic Diagnostic Adapter ODX Configuration

feat_req__diagnostics__db.content: The system shall include a diagnostic database to store DTCs, occurrence counts, and associated metadata for fault events.
feat_req__diagnostics__db.title: Diagnostic Database

feat_req__diagnostics__db_persistence.content: The diagnostic database shall store all diagnostic data persistently.
feat_req__diagnostics__db_persistence.title: Diagnostic Database Persistence

feat_req__diagnostics__fault_catalog_agg.content: The Diagnostic Fault Manager shall be configureable via the aggregated fault catalog derived from all fault libraries in the system.
feat_req__diagnostics__fault_catalog_agg.title: Fault Catalog Aggregation

feat_req__diagnostics__fault_lib.content: The system shall include a fault reporting library that provides an interface for applications and platform components to report diagnostic faults including metadata.
feat_req__diagnostics__fault_lib.title: Diagnostic Fault Library

feat_req__diagnostics__fault_lib_catalog.content: The fault library shall provide the ability to define faults via a component fault catalog for the scope of the respective parent component.
feat_req__diagnostics__fault_lib_catalog.title: Fault Library Catalog

feat_req__diagnostics__fault_lib_debounc.content: The fault library shall support configurable error debouncing.
feat_req__diagnostics__fault_lib_debounc.title: Fault Library Debouncing

feat_req__diagnostics__fault_manager.content: The system shall include a central diagnostic fault manager that aggregates data from fault libraries, provides DTC status to the SOVD server, and interfaces with a persistent diagnostic database.
feat_req__diagnostics__fault_manager.title: Diagnostic Fault Manager

feat_req__diagnostics__internal_com.content: All internal communication between diagnostic components that do not use UDS or SOVD protocols shall be implemented using the S-CORE::COM middleware.
feat_req__diagnostics__internal_com.title: Diagnostic system internal communication

feat_req__diagnostics__oem_plugin.content: The diagnostic system shall provide a plug-in mechanism to include OEM-specific features.
feat_req__diagnostics__oem_plugin.title: OEM Diagnostic Plug In

feat_req__diagnostics__service_app.content: The diagnostic system shall include a base service application (AKA routine) that is triggered by the SOVD Server and used to derive custom service applications.
feat_req__diagnostics__service_app.title: Diagnostic Service Application

feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_auth_mgr.content: The SOVD server shall enforce access control and validate client credentials.
feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_auth_mgr.title: SOVD Server Authentication Integration

feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_client.content: The system shall provide a SOVD client to allow external applications to communicate with the SOVD server.
feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_client.title: SOVD Client

feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_client_core.content: The SOVD client shall be designed as a reusable core component that can be deployed in off-board, on-board, or cloud environments.
feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_client_core.title: SOVD Client Deployment Core

feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_config.content: The system shall provide configuration management for SOVD components, including protocol parameters and security settings.
feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_config.title: SOVD Configuration

feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_config_mgr.content: The SOVD server shall integrate with the S-CORE Configuration Manager to support runtime access and modification of configuration data.
feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_config_mgr.title: SOVD Server Configuration Integration

feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_gateway.content: The system shall include a SOVD gateway to route diagnostic requests between different network domains and protocols.
feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_gateway.title: SOVD Gateway

feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_server.content: The diagnostic system shall include a central SOVD server that exposes diagnostic functionality via a standard REST interface.
feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_server.title: SOVD Server

feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_std.content: The SOVD implementation shall conform to the SOVD standard as defined in ISO/DIS 17978 (or the latest available draft or final publication).
feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_std.title: SOVD Standard

feat_req__diagnostics__uds2sovd_odx.content: The UDS2SOVD proxy shall support configuration via standardized ODX files to define which SOVD services are exposed via the UDS interface.
feat_req__diagnostics__uds2sovd_odx.title: UDS2SOVD Proxy ODX Configuration

feat_req__diagnostics__uds2sovd_proxy.content: The system shall include a proxy to translate UDS diagnostic requests to SOVD protocol requests.
feat_req__diagnostics__uds2sovd_proxy.title: UDS to SOVD Proxy

feat_req__feo__act_alloc_error.content:
During initialization (i.e. in the startup function of an activity), activities shall check for resource allocation
and report an error to the executor in case of failure.
feat_req__feo__act_alloc_error.title: Activity resource allocation error

feat_req__feo__act_shutdown_error.content:
If an activity fails in the shutdown function, the primary process shall shutdown all remaining activities
in arbitrary sequence and terminate itself.
feat_req__feo__act_shutdown_error.title: Activity shutdown error

feat_req__feo__act_startup_error.content:
If an error occurs during the execution of a startup function, the primary process shall abort calling
startup functions and terminate itself. For all of the activities
whose startup functions have already been called successfully, the corresponding shutdown functions shall be
executed in arbitrary sequence.
feat_req__feo__act_startup_error.title: Activity startup error

feat_req__feo__act_stepping_error.content:
If an activity fails in the step function, the primary process shall call shutdown for all activities
in arbitrary sequence and terminate itself.
feat_req__feo__act_stepping_error.title: Activity stepping error

feat_req__feo__act_timeout.content:
If a timeout occurs during startup, stepping or shutdown of an activity, the primary process shall shutdown all
successfully started activities in arbitrary sequence and terminate itself.
feat_req__feo__act_timeout.title: Activity timeout

feat_req__feo__activitiy_step.content:
Each activity is stepped once within each execution of the task chain they belong to.

Stepping is done by a call to an activity's `step` function.
feat_req__feo__activitiy_step.title: Stepping of activities

feat_req__feo__activity.content:
Activities are mapped to threads within primary or secondary processes.
Each activity is mapped to exactly one thread and provides the following functions:

* `init`: Initialization of the activity.
* `step`: Execution of the activity.
* `shutdown`: Shutdown of the activity.

The mapping is done in a configuration file and cannot be changed at runtime.
feat_req__feo__activity.title: Definition: Activity

feat_req__feo__activity_init.content:
Initialization of activities is done during application initialization.

Each activity is initialized by a call to its `init` function.

The `init` function will be invoked in the thread to which the activity is mapped.
Note that `init`, `step` and `shutdown` functions will be run in the same thread.
feat_req__feo__activity_init.title: Initialization of activities

feat_req__feo__activity_shutdown.content:
Shutdown of activities is done during application shutdown.

Each activity is shut down by a call to its `shutdown` function.

The `shutdown` function will be invoked in the thread to which the activity is mapped.
feat_req__feo__activity_shutdown.title: Shutdown of activities

feat_req__feo__agent.content:
In order to execute activities in secondary processes, the executor makes
use of an `Agent` for each secondary process and possibly also the primary process.
The agent receives commands from the executor, invokes actions on
activities within its process and reports back to the executor.

Each Activity that is part of the task chain is associated with an
Agent, which takes over the task to wait for a trigger from its
corresponding Executor. When the Agent gets a step request from the
Executor, it calls the Step function of the Activity There is exactly
one agent for each secondary process. The primary can but doesn't have to be
associated with an agent.
feat_req__feo__agent.title: Definition: Agent

feat_req__feo__alive_supervision.content:
The framework shall provide the functionality to enable the reporting of
alive supervision checkpoint to an external health management system
(e.g. watchdog)
feat_req__feo__alive_supervision.title: Alive supervision

feat_req__feo__application.content:
An application consists of one or more activities.

An application consists of one or more operating system processes.
In particular it consists of the primary process which handles the lifecycle, configuration and execution management.
It may optionally consist of one or more secondary processes.
The purpose of secondary processes is to run code in separate address spaces (Freedom From Interference) for safety reasons.
Each process (primary and secondary) belongs to exactly one application.
Each process contains one ore more operating system threads.
feat_req__feo__application.title: Definition: Application

feat_req__feo__application_lifecycle.content: The Application Lifecycle consists of 3 phases: Init, Run and Shutdown.
feat_req__feo__application_lifecycle.title: The lifecycle of an `Application` consists of 3 phases: Init, Run and Shutdown.

feat_req__feo__deadline_supervision.content:
The framework shall provide the functionality to enable the reporting of
deadline supervision checkpoints to an external health management system
(e.g. watchdog)
feat_req__feo__deadline_supervision.title: Support of deadline supervision checkpoints

feat_req__feo__logical_supervision.content:
The framework shall provide the functionality to enable the reporting of
logical supervision checkpoints to an external health management system
(e.g. watchdog)
feat_req__feo__logical_supervision.title: Support of logical supervision

feat_req__feo__response_term_request.content:
If the primary process receives a termination signal, it shall call the shutdown
function of all remaining activities in arbitrary sequence and terminate itself.

If a secondary process receives a termination signal, it shall terminate itself.
feat_req__feo__response_term_request.title: Response to termination request

feat_req__feo__secondary_conn_timeout.content:
If not all secondary processes connect to the primary in time, the primary shall terminate itself.
The startup functions shall not be triggered.
feat_req__feo__secondary_conn_timeout.title: Secondary connection timeout

feat_req__feo__service_activity.content:
* Service activities are a means to interact with the outside world, e.g. via
  network communication, direct sensor input or direct actuator output
* Service activities may also use APIs external to the framework
  (e.g. networking APIs, reading from external sensor devices, writing HW I/O, etc.)
feat_req__feo__service_activity.title: Definition: Service Activity

feat_req__feo__startup_timeout.content:
If not all activities reach their initialized state within a certain period of time (startup timeout),
the primary process shall shutdown all successfully started activities in arbitrary sequence and terminate itself.
feat_req__feo__startup_timeout.title: Startup timeout

feat_req__feo__task_chain.content:
All activities within an application are arranged within a `Task Chain`.
There is exactly one task chain per application.

The task chain configuration defines the execution order of the activities.
In particular it defines when the task chain is activated (typically in a cyclic manner) and in which order the activities will run.

Every task chain may have one or multiple input service activities which will run in the beginning.
The purpose of an input service activity is to collect external input signals and provide them to the other activities during task chain execution.
Every task may have one or more output service activities which will run in the end.
The purpose of an output service activity is to collect signals produced by activities within the task chain and send them to external entities.
feat_req__feo__task_chain.title: Definition: Task Chain

feat_req__feo__trustable_computation.content:
The framework shall provide mechanisms to check after the computation of
an Activity if the result is trustable.
This can be done e.g. via evaluation of floating point exceptions,
checking of hardware registers or status information of the
software platform.
feat_req__feo__trustable_computation.title: Trustable computation

feat_req__gen_ai__structured_vapi.content: The platform shall provide structured APIs (e.g., via MCP) to access vehicle state and invoke safe vehicle commands.
feat_req__gen_ai__structured_vapi.title: Structured Vehicle Interface

feat_req__gen_ai__ui.content: The platform shall provide a Prompting Interface for GenAI-based agents, enabling structured prompts, streaming output, and context-aware user interaction.
feat_req__gen_ai__ui.title: GenAI Interaction Layer

feat_req__gen_ai__validator.content: The platform shall validate all LLM-generated actions via domain-specific policies before they are executed.
feat_req__gen_ai__validator.title: GenAI Action Validation

feat_req__gen_ai__workloads_execution.content: The platform shall support the execution of Generative AI models (e.g., LLMs) on embedded automotive hardware.
feat_req__gen_ai__workloads_execution.title: GenAI Execution

feat_req__ipc__availability.content:
The IPC binding shall ensure availability of its communication, so that the availability is independent per
criticality level.
feat_req__ipc__availability.title: IPC Availability

feat_req__ipc__confidentiality.content: The IPC binding shall ensure confidentiality of its communication.
feat_req__ipc__confidentiality.title: IPC Confidentiality

feat_req__ipc__integrity.content: The IPC binding shall ensure integrity of its communication.
feat_req__ipc__integrity.title: IPC Integrity

feat_req__ipc__zero_copy.content: IPC communication shall be possible without copying to-be-transferred data.
feat_req__ipc__zero_copy.title: Zero-Copy Approach

feat_req__lifecycle__aslr_support.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching process with
:term:`ASLR` (Address Space Layout Randomization).
feat_req__lifecycle__aslr_support.title: ASLR support

feat_req__lifecycle__capability_support.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching :term:`Processes <Process>`
with configured OS-specific capabilities and privileges.
feat_req__lifecycle__capability_support.title: Process capability support

feat_req__lifecycle__central_default_def.content: The Launch Manager shall be able to centrally define defaults for specific properties for the set of executables.
feat_req__lifecycle__central_default_def.title: Global process properties

feat_req__lifecycle__check_dependency_ex.content: The Launch Manager shall provide a method to check if at least one dependency has been executed.
feat_req__lifecycle__check_dependency_ex.title: Condition check based on at least one dependency

feat_req__lifecycle__clustering_modules_.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support to clustering set of components
as modules.
feat_req__lifecycle__clustering_modules_.title: Module support

feat_req__lifecycle__cond_process_start.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support to conditionally start a process
or process group based on the return value of a single or multiple :term:`Processes <Process>`
executed before.
feat_req__lifecycle__cond_process_start.title: Conditionally launch of processes

feat_req__lifecycle__condition_check_met.content: The Launch Manager shall provide a method for condition check based on process state.
feat_req__lifecycle__condition_check_met.title: Condition check based on status

feat_req__lifecycle__config_actions_cond.content: The Launch Manager shall provide a way to configure actions based on condition evaluation i.e. to be able to configure SUCCESS and FAILURE case.
feat_req__lifecycle__config_actions_cond.title: Configuration of action based on condition evaluation

feat_req__lifecycle__configurable_timeou.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for configurable timeout
:term:`Interval` to wait for the process to be stopped.
feat_req__lifecycle__configurable_timeou.title: Stop timeout

feat_req__lifecycle__configurable_wait_t.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for configurable wait time
that shall elapse before repeating :term:`Recovery Action`.
feat_req__lifecycle__configurable_wait_t.title: Monitoring and recovery: recovery wait time

feat_req__lifecycle__consistent_dependen.content: The Launch Manager shall reject an inconsistent definition of set of executables dependencies.
feat_req__lifecycle__consistent_dependen.title: Invalid dependency

feat_req__lifecycle__control_commands.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for commands to control
component states.
feat_req__lifecycle__control_commands.title: Control commands

feat_req__lifecycle__controlif_status.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall be able to report status on components via the
:term:`Control Interface`.

Note: status can be "started/running/degraded" - refer to documentation for details
feat_req__lifecycle__controlif_status.title: Report "started/running/degraded"

feat_req__lifecycle__custom_cond_support.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support to wait for configurable custom
conditions, which can be signaled from applications via :term:`Control Interface`.
feat_req__lifecycle__custom_cond_support.title: Control interface support

feat_req__lifecycle__cwd_support.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a process with a
given :term:`Working Directory`.
feat_req__lifecycle__cwd_support.title: CWD support

feat_req__lifecycle__dag_logging_control.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide the possibility to log the :term:`DAG`
in a human readable format, triggered via :term:`Control Interface`.
feat_req__lifecycle__dag_logging_control.title: Logging DAG

feat_req__lifecycle__debug_support.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching process with a
given set of debug arguments in debug mode.
feat_req__lifecycle__debug_support.title: Launching process in debug mode

feat_req__lifecycle__define_swc_dependen.content: The Launch Manager shall provide a way to define for each :term:`SWC` (Software Components), its dependencies.
feat_req__lifecycle__define_swc_dependen.title: Condition check for each SWC its dependencies

feat_req__lifecycle__dependency_check.content: The Launch Manager shall provide a method to check if all dependencies have been executed.
feat_req__lifecycle__dependency_check.title: Condition check based on all dependency

feat_req__lifecycle__dependency_visu.content: The Launch Manager shall have the means to log the current dependencies in a format that can be visualized when requested.
feat_req__lifecycle__dependency_visu.title: Configuration dependency view

feat_req__lifecycle__deps_visualization.content: The Launch Manager shall have the means to generate the specified dependencies in a format that can be visualized.
feat_req__lifecycle__deps_visualization.title: Configuration Dependency view

feat_req__lifecycle__detach_parent_proce.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a process to
detach from parent.
feat_req__lifecycle__detach_parent_proce.title: Process detach from parent support

feat_req__lifecycle__drop_supervsion.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support to dropping all surveillance
and failure reaction activities of :term:`Processes <Process>`.
feat_req__lifecycle__drop_supervsion.title: Dropping process responsibility

feat_req__lifecycle__env_variable_cond_c.content: The Launch Manager shall provide a method for condition check for environment variable.
feat_req__lifecycle__env_variable_cond_c.title: Condition check based on ENV

feat_req__lifecycle__ext_monitor_notify.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for external monitors to get
notified on process life status.
feat_req__lifecycle__ext_monitor_notify.title: Process state notification

feat_req__lifecycle__failure_detect.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall be able to detect and react to failure of the
process launch.
feat_req__lifecycle__failure_detect.title: Process launch monitoring

feat_req__lifecycle__fast_shutdown_suppo.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall support fast shutdown by terminating itself
without affecting the started :term:`Processes <Process>`.
feat_req__lifecycle__fast_shutdown_suppo.title: Fast shutdown

feat_req__lifecycle__fd_inheritance.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a process with
given :term:`File Descriptor` inheritance restrictions.
feat_req__lifecycle__fd_inheritance.title: File descriptor inheritance support

feat_req__lifecycle__launch_manager_shut.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall support normal shutdown by terminating all
process in the dependency order.
feat_req__lifecycle__launch_manager_shut.title: Normal shutdown

feat_req__lifecycle__launch_priority_sup.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a process with a
given priority.
feat_req__lifecycle__launch_priority_sup.title: Process priority support

feat_req__lifecycle__launch_support.content: The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching :term:`Processes <Process>`.
feat_req__lifecycle__launch_support.title: Support for launching processes

feat_req__lifecycle__launcher_exit_shutd.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall exit after performing shutdown operation by
stopping all the :term:`Processes <Process>` it owns in the dependency order when requested.
feat_req__lifecycle__launcher_exit_shutd.title: Launch Manager shutdown

feat_req__lifecycle__launcher_status_sto.content: The Launch Manager shall provide a way to store the status of the launched process.
feat_req__lifecycle__launcher_status_sto.title: Launched Process status

feat_req__lifecycle__lazy_check.content: The Launch Manager shall check availability of executables in the filesystem only when the executable shall required to be executed.
feat_req__lifecycle__lazy_check.title: Lazy check of configured commands

feat_req__lifecycle__liveliness_detectio.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall be able to detect and react to loss of
:term:`Liveliness` of the :term:`Processes <Process>` it owns.
feat_req__lifecycle__liveliness_detectio.title: Process liveliness detection

feat_req__lifecycle__lm_ext_watchdog_cfg.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall support configuring the :term:`Interval` of
the internal health check executions.
feat_req__lifecycle__lm_ext_watchdog_cfg.title: Launch manager external monitoring configuration

feat_req__lifecycle__lm_ext_watchdog_not.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall trigger a notification to an external
:term:`Watchdog` for each successful self monitoring test execution.
feat_req__lifecycle__lm_ext_watchdog_not.title: Launch manager external watchdog notification

feat_req__lifecycle__lm_ext_wdg_failed_t.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall not trigger an external :term:`Watchdog`
notification if an internal health check failed.
feat_req__lifecycle__lm_ext_wdg_failed_t.title: Launch manager external watchdog notification - failed test

feat_req__lifecycle__lm_self_health_chec.content: The :term:`Launch Manager` shall implement time based cyclical monitoring of itself.
feat_req__lifecycle__lm_self_health_chec.title: Launch manager self health check

feat_req__lifecycle__log_timestamp.content: The :term:`Launch Manager` logs shall contain timestamp information.
feat_req__lifecycle__log_timestamp.title: Logging timestamp

feat_req__lifecycle__modular_config_supp.content: The launch manager shall provide modular configuration file support to configure process attributes.
feat_req__lifecycle__modular_config_supp.title: Configuration file support

feat_req__lifecycle__monitor_abnormal_te.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for monitoring abnormal
termination of :term:`Processes <Process>`.
feat_req__lifecycle__monitor_abnormal_te.title: Process crash monitoring

feat_req__lifecycle__monitoring_processe.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for monitoring adopted
:term:`Processes <Process>`.
feat_req__lifecycle__monitoring_processe.title: Monitoring and recovery: adopted process monitoring

feat_req__lifecycle__multi_instance_supp.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall be able to run in multiple instances with its
own configurations on a system.
feat_req__lifecycle__multi_instance_supp.title: Multi-instance

feat_req__lifecycle__multi_start_support.content: The Launch Manager shall permit an executable to be launched more than once.
feat_req__lifecycle__multi_start_support.title: Multiple instance of executable

feat_req__lifecycle__oci_compliant.content: The Launch Manager shall be compliant to the `OCI Specification v1.2.0 <https://github.com/opencontainers/runtime-spec/releases/tag/v1.2.0>`__.
feat_req__lifecycle__oci_compliant.title: OCI Compliant

feat_req__lifecycle__offline_config_vali.content: The Launch Manager shall have a means to validate the configuration offline.
feat_req__lifecycle__offline_config_vali.title: Configuration Verification tool

feat_req__lifecycle__parallel_launch_sup.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching :term:`Processes <Process>`
in parallel.
feat_req__lifecycle__parallel_launch_sup.title: Launching processes in parallel

feat_req__lifecycle__path_condition_chec.content: The Launch Manager shall provide a method for condition check for a path.
feat_req__lifecycle__path_condition_chec.title: Condition check based on path

feat_req__lifecycle__polling_interval.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for per condition configurable
:term:`Polling Interval` for launch conditions to be checked.
feat_req__lifecycle__polling_interval.title: Conditional launch polling interval

feat_req__lifecycle__process_failure_rea.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall be able to react to a process failure by
optionally performing one of relaunching the process, stopping the process,
stopping the process and starting another process, or triggering :term:`QNX`
:term:`Operating System` (:term:`QOS`) Device Safe State (:term:`DSS`).
feat_req__lifecycle__process_failure_rea.title: Recovery

feat_req__lifecycle__process_input_outpu.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support to pass the output of one or
multiple :term:`Processes <Process>` as input arguments to another process.
feat_req__lifecycle__process_input_outpu.title: Forward process information

feat_req__lifecycle__process_launch_args.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a process with a
given set of arguments.
feat_req__lifecycle__process_launch_args.title: Handling process args

feat_req__lifecycle__process_logging_sup.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for logging process launches,
:term:`Processes <Process>` exit/recovery, internal tasks, and interaction with external monitor.
feat_req__lifecycle__process_logging_sup.title: Logging state transitions

feat_req__lifecycle__process_monitoring.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall monitor the state of the :term:`Processes <Process>` as
specified by the set of executables.
feat_req__lifecycle__process_monitoring.title: Process monitoring

feat_req__lifecycle__process_ordering.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for ordering the launching of
:term:`Processes <Process>` based on the dependencies.
feat_req__lifecycle__process_ordering.title: Process dependency handling

feat_req__lifecycle__process_rlimit_supp.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a process with a
given set of system resource limits (rlimit).
feat_req__lifecycle__process_rlimit_supp.title: Resource limit support

feat_req__lifecycle__process_state_comm.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall have a means for the launched :term:`Processes <Process>`
to communicate a state, which represents the launched processes' internal state,
to the launcher.
feat_req__lifecycle__process_state_comm.title: Process state

feat_req__lifecycle__process_termination.content: The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for terminating :term:`Processes <Process>`.
feat_req__lifecycle__process_termination.title: Terminating process

feat_req__lifecycle__query_commands.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for commands to query component
states.
feat_req__lifecycle__query_commands.title: Query commands

feat_req__lifecycle__recov_run_target_sw.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall support switching to a different :term:`Run target` as
recovery action in case a single process terminated abnormally or lost its
:term:`Liveliness`.
feat_req__lifecycle__recov_run_target_sw.title: Run target switch as recovery action

feat_req__lifecycle__recovery_action_sup.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall support :term:`Recovery Action` for the
abnormally terminated :term:`Processes <Process>`.
feat_req__lifecycle__recovery_action_sup.title: Recovery action

feat_req__lifecycle__request_run_target_.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall be able to start a named :term:`Run target` respecting the
dependencies when requested.
feat_req__lifecycle__request_run_target_.title: Request run target launch

feat_req__lifecycle__retries_configurabl.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall support a configurable amount of retries in
case error occurs during startup of a component (e.g. file not available) occurs.
feat_req__lifecycle__retries_configurabl.title: Configurable amount of retries

feat_req__lifecycle__run_target_support.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for :term:`run targets <Run target>` to define
collections of :term:`Processes <Process>` that can be launched together.
feat_req__lifecycle__run_target_support.title: Run target support

feat_req__lifecycle__runmask_support.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a process with a
given runmask.
feat_req__lifecycle__runmask_support.title: CPU runmask support

feat_req__lifecycle__running_processes.content: The :term:`Launch Manager` shall be able to adopt already running :term:`Processes <Process>`.
feat_req__lifecycle__running_processes.title: Process adoption

feat_req__lifecycle__runtime_config_comp.content: The launch manager shall provide modular configuration files support for configurations coming from `OCI runtime configuration<https://github.com/opencontainers/runtime-spec/blob/v1.2.0/config.md>`.
feat_req__lifecycle__runtime_config_comp.title: Runtime configuration compliance

feat_req__lifecycle__scheduling_policy.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a process with
certain scheduling policy.
feat_req__lifecycle__scheduling_policy.title: Scheduling support

feat_req__lifecycle__secpol_non_root.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support to be started with security
policy as non-root.
feat_req__lifecycle__secpol_non_root.title: Non-root support

feat_req__lifecycle__session_extension.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for extending already running
session with additional new configuration file.
feat_req__lifecycle__session_extension.title: Updating configuration

feat_req__lifecycle__shutdown_signal.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall implement a shutdown by sending a SIGTERM to
the process. In case the process does not terminate itself, a SIGKILL shall be sent.
feat_req__lifecycle__shutdown_signal.title: Shutdown signal handling

feat_req__lifecycle__slog2_logging.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall support OS specific logging facilities to analyze the early
boot sequence.
feat_req__lifecycle__slog2_logging.title: Logging slog2 and file support

feat_req__lifecycle__slow_shutdown_suppo.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall support slow shutdown by terminating the
:term:`Processes <Process>` in the dependency order.
feat_req__lifecycle__slow_shutdown_suppo.title: Slow shutdown

feat_req__lifecycle__smart_watchdog_conf.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall support a smart :term:`Watchdog`, configurable
per process.
feat_req__lifecycle__smart_watchdog_conf.title: Monitoring and recovery: watchdog support

feat_req__lifecycle__start_named_run_tar.content: The :term:`Launch Manager` shall be able to start a named :term:`Run target`.
feat_req__lifecycle__start_named_run_tar.title: Launching run target

feat_req__lifecycle__std_handle_redir.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for stdin, stdout, stderr
redirection.
feat_req__lifecycle__std_handle_redir.title: Standard handle redirection

feat_req__lifecycle__stop_order_spec.content: The Launch Manager shall permit the stop order of non-dependent processes to be specified.
feat_req__lifecycle__stop_order_spec.title: Coordination stop dependency

feat_req__lifecycle__stop_process_depend.content: The Launch Manager shall be able to stop a process when all it's dependents are stopped if specified in the set of executables.
feat_req__lifecycle__stop_process_depend.title: Dangling dependency

feat_req__lifecycle__stop_sequence.content: The Launch Manager shall provide a way to define the stop sequence for each :term:`SWC` (Software Components).
feat_req__lifecycle__stop_sequence.title: Condition check for each SWC its stop sequence

feat_req__lifecycle__supplementary_group.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a process with a
given set of supplementary groups.
feat_req__lifecycle__supplementary_group.title: Supplementary group support

feat_req__lifecycle__support_held_state.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a process in a state
waiting for a debugger connection.
feat_req__lifecycle__support_held_state.title: Launching process in state waiting for a debugger connection

feat_req__lifecycle__support_secpol_type.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a process with a
given security policy.
feat_req__lifecycle__support_secpol_type.title: Security policy support

feat_req__lifecycle__switch_run_targets.content: The :term:`Launch Manager` shall be able to switch between different :term:`run targets <Run target>`.
feat_req__lifecycle__switch_run_targets.title: Switch between run targets

feat_req__lifecycle__terminal_support.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a terminal or a
session leader.
feat_req__lifecycle__terminal_support.title: Launching terminal

feat_req__lifecycle__terminationn_depend.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall terminate the :term:`Processes <Process>` based on the
dependency order.
feat_req__lifecycle__terminationn_depend.title: Handling process dependency in termination

feat_req__lifecycle__time_to_wait_config.content:
The time to wait, before SIGKILL is sent shall be configurable. In case "0" is
stated, the SIGKILL shall be sent immediately.
feat_req__lifecycle__time_to_wait_config.title: Configurable delay between SIGTERM and SIGKILL

feat_req__lifecycle__total_wait_time_sup.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for per condition configurable
total wait time for launch conditions to be satisfied.
feat_req__lifecycle__total_wait_time_sup.title: Condition timeout

feat_req__lifecycle__uid_gid_support.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a process with a
given :term:`UID`/:term:`GID` (user name/Group Identifier).
feat_req__lifecycle__uid_gid_support.title: Process user, group IDs support

feat_req__lifecycle__validate_conditions.content: The Launch Manager shall be able to validate the pre-start conditions of the executable using the conditions.
feat_req__lifecycle__validate_conditions.title: Pre-start validation

feat_req__lifecycle__validation_conditio.content: The Launch Manager shall be able to validate the start of the executable using the conditions.
feat_req__lifecycle__validation_conditio.title: post-start validation

feat_req__lifecycle__waitfor_support.content: The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide launching processes based on conditions.
feat_req__lifecycle__waitfor_support.title: Conditional launching

feat_req__log__err_handling_nonrec.content: In case of non-recoverable error, the logging :term:`framework` shall deactivate silently and set an error state reported on shutdown.
feat_req__log__err_handling_nonrec.title: Error Handling - Non-Recoverable Errors

feat_req__logging__asil_support.content:
The logging :term:`framework` shall support the ASIL level of the user function to ensure compliance with the safety requirements of the application.

Additional Information: Freedom from interfernce must be guaranteed with regard to the calling components.
feat_req__logging__asil_support.title: Safety - ASIL Level Support

feat_req__logging__boot_logging.content:
The logging :term:`framework` shall support logging of data to memory which survives a reboot
cycle.
feat_req__logging__boot_logging.title: Previous boot logging

feat_req__logging__compat_dlt.content:
The logging :term:`framework` shall be :term:`DLT` compatible.

Additional Information: support for DLT message format, sending and receiving DLT messages, and integration with existing DLT tools and infrastructure.
feat_req__logging__compat_dlt.title: Compatibility - DLT Protocol

feat_req__logging__compat_languages.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support C++, Rust, and Python programming languages.
feat_req__logging__compat_languages.title: Compatibility - Supported Programming Languages

feat_req__logging__compat_os.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support QNX and Linux operating systems (encapsulated via OSAL).
feat_req__logging__compat_os.title: Compatibility - Supported Operating Systems

feat_req__logging__config_buffer_size.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall allow configuration of internal buffers sizes.
feat_req__logging__config_buffer_size.title: Configuration - Buffer Size

feat_req__logging__config_custom_types.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall allow extensions for custom log types.
feat_req__logging__config_custom_types.title: Configuration - Custom Types Extension

feat_req__logging__config_entity_id.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall allow configuration of logging entity IDs.
feat_req__logging__config_entity_id.title: Configuration - Logging Entity ID

feat_req__logging__config_fallback.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall provide fallback configurations, such as application-wide or system-wide defaults.
feat_req__logging__config_fallback.title: Configuration - Fallback Configurations

feat_req__logging__config_log_filter.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall allow configuration of log filters.
feat_req__logging__config_log_filter.title: Configuration - Log Filter

feat_req__logging__config_log_level.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support configuration of :term:`log levels <Log level>`.
feat_req__logging__config_log_level.title: Configuration - Log Level

feat_req__logging__config_on_demand.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support on-demand functionality, such as enabling or disabling log storage.
feat_req__logging__config_on_demand.title: Configuration - On-Demand Functionality

feat_req__logging__config_permissions.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall allow configuration of permission settings for log access.
feat_req__logging__config_permissions.title: Configuration - Permission Settings

feat_req__logging__config_storage_size.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall allow configuration of storage size per log file.
feat_req__logging__config_storage_size.title: Configuration - Storage Size

feat_req__logging__context_log_level.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall allow context-specific :term:`log level` activation at runtime to enable fine-grained control over logging behavior.
feat_req__logging__context_log_level.title: Context-Specific Log Level Activation

feat_req__logging__early_startup.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support logging of early startup events to capture critical initialization information.
feat_req__logging__early_startup.title: Logging of Early Startup Events

feat_req__logging__entity_identifier.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support :term:`logging entity identifiers<logging entity identifier>` for each log entry.
feat_req__logging__entity_identifier.title: Log entity Identifier

feat_req__logging__error_handling_isolat.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall ensure that user applications are not affected by logging :term:`framework` errors.
feat_req__logging__error_handling_isolat.title: Error Handling - Application Isolation

feat_req__logging__error_handling_recove.content: In case of recoverable error, the logging :term:`framework` shall continue the current operations.
feat_req__logging__error_handling_recove.title: Error Handling - Recoverable Errors

feat_req__logging__filtering_entity_id.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support filtering by :term:`logging entity identifiers<logging entity identifier>`.
feat_req__logging__filtering_entity_id.title: Log Filtering - Logging Entity ID

feat_req__logging__filtering_log_levels.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support filtering by :term:`log levels <Log level>`.
feat_req__logging__filtering_log_levels.title: Log Filtering - Log Levels

feat_req__logging__log_sinks_cloud_drive.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support cloud-native drives via network as log sinks.
feat_req__logging__log_sinks_cloud_drive.title: Log Sinks - Cloud Native Drive

feat_req__logging__log_sinks_console.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support console as a log sink.
feat_req__logging__log_sinks_console.title: Log Sinks - Console

feat_req__logging__log_sinks_local_fs.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support local file system as log sink.
feat_req__logging__log_sinks_local_fs.title: Log Sinks - Local File System

feat_req__logging__log_sinks_network.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support network channels, including a second dedicated Ethernet channel, as log sinks.
feat_req__logging__log_sinks_network.title: Log Sinks - Network

feat_req__logging__log_sinks_stdout.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall ensure logs appear on stdout when running unit tests.
feat_req__logging__log_sinks_stdout.title: Log Sinks - Stdout for Unit Tests

feat_req__logging__log_sources.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support :term:`component` features and :term:` platform` as log sources.
feat_req__logging__log_sources.title: Log Sources - Component and Platform

feat_req__logging__log_sources_user_app.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support user application as log source.
feat_req__logging__log_sources_user_app.title: Log Sources - User Application

feat_req__logging__message_loss_detectio.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall detect and report any message loss.
feat_req__logging__message_loss_detectio.title: Message Loss Detection - Detection and Reporting

feat_req__logging__message_loss_handling.content:
The logging :term:`framework` shall provide mechanisms to handle message loss gracefully.

Additional Information: e.g. buffering or prioritizing critical messages
feat_req__logging__message_loss_handling.title: Message Loss Detection - Graceful Handling

feat_req__logging__prioritization.content: The logging framework shall prioritize logs in case of resource conflicts to ensure critical logs are not lost.
feat_req__logging__prioritization.title: Log Prioritization

feat_req__logging__qos_message_handling.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall provide:term:` QoS` for handling overflows or dropping log messages.
feat_req__logging__qos_message_handling.title: Quality of Service - Message Handling

feat_req__logging__resource_comm_channel.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall minimize communication channel resource consumption.
feat_req__logging__resource_comm_channel.title: Resource Consumption - Communication Channel

feat_req__logging__resource_performance.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall have low impact on overall system performance.
feat_req__logging__resource_performance.title: Resource Consumption - Performance Impact

feat_req__logging__resource_runtime.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall minimize runtime resource consumption.
feat_req__logging__resource_runtime.title: Resource Consumption - Runtime Resources

feat_req__logging__resource_storage.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall minimize storage resource consumption.
feat_req__logging__resource_storage.title: Resource Consumption - Storage

feat_req__logging__security_log_access.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall ensure that only authorized users can access log files.
feat_req__logging__security_log_access.title: Security - Log File Access

feat_req__logging__severity_levels.content: The logging framework shall support a log level for each log entry.
feat_req__logging__severity_levels.title: Log Severity Levels

feat_req__logging__sink_device.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support configuration of the log storage device.
feat_req__logging__sink_device.title: Log Sinks - Storage Device

feat_req__logging__sink_multiple_device.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support multiple log storage devices.
feat_req__logging__sink_multiple_device.title: Log Sinks - multiple Storage Device

feat_req__logging__sink_strategy.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support configurable :term:`log storage strategy`.
feat_req__logging__sink_strategy.title: Log Sinks - Storage Strategy

feat_req__logging__system_class.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall be classified according to the overall system's safety concept if logging information is part of the verification strategy.
feat_req__logging__system_class.title: Safety - System Classification

feat_req__logging__timestamping_local.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support local timestamps for each log entry.
feat_req__logging__timestamping_local.title: Timestamping - Local Timestamp

feat_req__logging__timestamping_original.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support original timestamps for routed log entries.
feat_req__logging__timestamping_original.title: Timestamping - Original Timestamp

feat_req__logging__timestamping_sync.content: The logging :term:`framework` shall support timestamp synchronization for log entries coming from different :term:`logging nodes <logging node>`.
feat_req__logging__timestamping_sync.title: Timestamping - Timestamp Synchronization

feat_req__orchestration__exec_async_rt.content: The executor shall provide a cooperative task runtime for async programming based on the definition of Rust's async model (see `Asynchronous Programming in Rust <https://rust-lang.github.io/async-book>`).
feat_req__orchestration__exec_async_rt.title: Async Cooperative Task Runtime

feat_req__orchestration__exec_block_thre.content: The system shall support execution of tasks containing blocking calls on dedicated OS threads isolated from cooperative scheduling.
feat_req__orchestration__exec_block_thre.title: Dedicated Threads for Blocking Operations

feat_req__orchestration__exec_fifo_fair_.content: The Executor shall support FIFO or fairness-based scheduling among cooperative tasks.
feat_req__orchestration__exec_fifo_fair_.title: FIFO or Fairness Scheduling

feat_req__orchestration__exec_fixed_pool.content: Executor instances shall run tasks on a statically configured thread pool with a fixed thread count.
feat_req__orchestration__exec_fixed_pool.title: Fixed-Size Thread Pool

feat_req__orchestration__exec_no_int_pri.content: Cooperative tasks within an Executor shall execute without internal priority distinctions.
feat_req__orchestration__exec_no_int_pri.title: No Internal Priorities for Cooperative Tasks

feat_req__orchestration__exec_os_prio.content: Threads within an Executor not involved in safety-critical tasks shall share identical OS-level priority.
feat_req__orchestration__exec_os_prio.title: Uniform OS Priority for Non-Safety Threads

feat_req__orchestration__exec_pool_isola.content: Executor instances shall isolate their thread pools from each other.
feat_req__orchestration__exec_pool_isola.title: Isolated Thread Pools

feat_req__orchestration__exec_preempt_sa.content: The Executor shall support preemptive scheduling of special safety-critical tasks, guaranteeing their execution.
feat_req__orchestration__exec_preempt_sa.title: Preemptive Scheduling for Safety Tasks

feat_req__orchestration__exec_safe_task_.content: Safety-critical tasks shall be prioritized separately from standard cooperative tasks.
feat_req__orchestration__exec_safe_task_.title: Separate Priority for Safety Tasks

feat_req__orchestration__exec_scale_inst.content: Scaling of Executor resources shall be achieved through additional Executor instances rather than dynamic thread scaling.
feat_req__orchestration__exec_scale_inst.title: Scale via Additional Executors

feat_req__orchestration__exec_thread_aff.content: Thread affinity to CPU cores shall be configurable per Executor instance.
feat_req__orchestration__exec_thread_aff.title: Configurable Thread Affinity

feat_req__orchestration__exec_yielding.content: The executor shall provide guidelines for dividing long-running operations into smaller, cooperatively yielding segments.
feat_req__orchestration__exec_yielding.title: Yielding Guidelines for Long Operations

feat_req__orchestration__ext_health_inds.content: Executor and Orchestrator frameworks shall expose health indicators for integration with external supervisory systems.
feat_req__orchestration__ext_health_inds.title: Health Indicators Export

feat_req__orchestration__ext_task_health.content: Frameworks shall internally verify task-level health status based on timing constraints and fault-handling execution.
feat_req__orchestration__ext_task_health.title: Internal Task Health Verification

feat_req__orchestration__gen_det_scale.content: The Executor and Orchestrator shall maintain determinism and scalability suitable for mixed-criticality environments.
feat_req__orchestration__gen_det_scale.title: Determinism and Scalability

feat_req__orchestration__gen_excl_ipc.content: The system shall use the approved IPC feature exclusively for all inter-process synchronization.
feat_req__orchestration__gen_excl_ipc.title: Exclusive Use of IPC Feature for Inter Process Synchronization

feat_req__orchestration__gen_preempt_act.content: Preemptive scheduling shall only be activated explicitly for tasks with safety or critical timing constraints.
feat_req__orchestration__gen_preempt_act.title: Explicit Preemption Activation

feat_req__orchestration__obsv_flow_vis.content: Observability shall provide visibility into Program execution flow, event synchronization points, and timing violations.
feat_req__orchestration__obsv_flow_vis.title: Program Flow and Timing Visibility

feat_req__orchestration__obsv_fw_integ.content: Tracing points shall integrate seamlessly with established tracing frameworks like Perfetto and LTTng.
feat_req__orchestration__obsv_fw_integ.title: Integration with Tracing Frameworks

feat_req__orchestration__obsv_lifecycle_.content: Observability shall capture task lifecycle events, Executor queue metrics, and mapping of user-space tasks to OS threads.
feat_req__orchestration__obsv_lifecycle_.title: Task Lifecycle and Queue Metrics

feat_req__orchestration__obsv_trace_corr.content: The Executor and Orchestrator shall expose structured tracing points correlating user-space task scheduling with OS-level scheduling.
feat_req__orchestration__obsv_trace_corr.title: Trace Correlation Points

feat_req__orchestration__orch_code_api.content: The Orchestrator shall offer a code-first API to integrate directly with application logic without external DSL/IDL.
feat_req__orchestration__orch_code_api.title: Code-First Integration API

feat_req__orchestration__orch_ctrl_flows.content: Programs shall explicitly define sequential, parallel, conditional execution flows, loops, and timing contracts.
feat_req__orchestration__orch_ctrl_flows.title: Explicit Control Flows and Timing

feat_req__orchestration__orch_event_comm.content: Programs shall communicate exclusively through explicitly defined events.
feat_req__orchestration__orch_event_comm.title: Event-Only Communication

feat_req__orchestration__orch_event_sync.content: Programs shall support explicit event-based synchronization and trigger conditions.
feat_req__orchestration__orch_event_sync.title: Event-Based Synchronization

feat_req__orchestration__orch_fault_mon.content: Programs shall contain integrated fault-handling logic and execution monitors to enforce timing constraints.
feat_req__orchestration__orch_fault_mon.title: Fault-Handling and Monitors

feat_req__orchestration__orch_multi_prog.content: Executors may host multiple Programs to support resource sharing.
feat_req__orchestration__orch_multi_prog.title: Multi-Program Support per Executor

feat_req__orchestration__orch_safety_tas.content: Critical timing or safety paths within Programs shall be executed via preemptive special tasks provided by the Executor.
feat_req__orchestration__orch_safety_tas.title: Safety Tasks in Programs

feat_req__orchestration__orch_single_dep.content: Each Program shall be deployed exclusively on a single Executor instance.
feat_req__orchestration__orch_single_dep.title: Single-Executor Deployment

feat_req__orchestration__orch_static_gra.content: The Orchestrator shall provide a runtime-static Program abstraction representing computation logic as execution graphs.
feat_req__orchestration__orch_static_gra.title: Static Program Execution Graphs

feat_req__persistency__access_control.content:
The Persistency shall ensure that only authorized applications can access individual data stores.

.. note::
   Access control is essential to prevent unauthorized access and modification of sensitive data.
   The Persistency shall implement mechanisms to enforce access control policies based on user roles and permissions.
feat_req__persistency__access_control.title: Separate data stores

feat_req__persistency__async_api.content: The Persistency shall provide an asynchronous API for time consuming operations like loading and storing of data.
feat_req__persistency__async_api.title: Asynchronous operation

feat_req__persistency__async_completion.content: The Persistency shall provide a mechanism to signal the completion of an asynchronous operations to the application.
feat_req__persistency__async_completion.title: Signalling completion of asynchronous operation

feat_req__persistency__atomic_store.content:
The Persistency shall support atomic write operation for entire storage to ensure data consistency.

.. note::

   Atomic write operation guarantee that either all key-value pairs are written, or no changes are made at all.
   This is required to prevent malfunctions when individual key-value pairs are dependent on each other.
feat_req__persistency__atomic_store.title: Atomic store operation

feat_req__persistency__cached_access.content: The Persistency shall support caching mechanisms to improve access times for frequently accessed key-value pairs.
feat_req__persistency__cached_access.title: Cached access

feat_req__persistency__cfg.content:
The Persistency shall support configuration via a configuration file.
The configuration shall include:

- Global settings:
   - Maximum number of KVS instances
   - Maximum size of a key

- Settings for KVS instance:
   - Instance identifier
   - Storage URI
   - Maximum number of Key-Value pairs
   - Maximum number of snapshots
   - Maximum consumed storage size (Including all metadata and redundant data)
   - Security settings
   - Redundancy settings
   - Backend specific settings

Configuration file shall be optional and all configuration attributes shall have sensible default values defined at compile time.

.. note::
   To improve the user experience during rapid prototyping, the Persistency shall also be able to operate without a configuration file.
feat_req__persistency__cfg.title: Configuration

feat_req__persistency__concurrency.content: The Persistency shall support concurrent access to key-value pairs from multiple threads within the same process.
feat_req__persistency__concurrency.title: Intra-Process data access

feat_req__persistency__confidential_stor.content:
The Persistency shall support confidential storage of key-value pairs using encryption mechanisms.

.. note::
   Confidential storage is essential to protect sensitive data from unauthorized access, especially in scenarios where the storage medium may be exposed to potential threats.
feat_req__persistency__confidential_stor.title: Confidential storage

feat_req__persistency__cpp_rust.content: The Persistency shall provide native API support for both C++ and Rust programming languages.
feat_req__persistency__cpp_rust.title: C++ and Rust language support

feat_req__persistency__default_value_fil.content:
The Persistency shall support import of default values using an external file.

.. note::
   Default values are read-only and cannot be modified at runtime. This requirement addresses the provisioning of default values
   during initial deployment. See :need:`feat_req__persistency__tooling`.
feat_req__persistency__default_value_fil.title: Provisioning of default values via external file

feat_req__persistency__default_value_get.content: The Persistency shall support retrieval of the default value associated with a key.
feat_req__persistency__default_value_get.title: Retrieval of default values

feat_req__persistency__default_values.content: The Persistency shall support predefined default values for keys.
feat_req__persistency__default_values.title: Default values

feat_req__persistency__dev_mode.content:
The Persistency shall support the development mode.
The development mode shall allow unrestricted data access and bypass security policies.
feat_req__persistency__dev_mode.title: Support development mode

feat_req__persistency__direct_access.content:
The Persistency shall support direct access to key-value pairs without the necessity to load the entire storage to RAM in advance.

.. note::
   Direct access improves availability of data and reduces memory consumption for large data sets.
feat_req__persistency__direct_access.title: Direct access

feat_req__persistency__dynamic_memory_al.content:
The Persistency shall not allocate dynamic memory during runtime. All required dynamic memory shall be allocated during initialization.

.. note::

   Dynamic memory allocation violates freedom from interference as the `HEAP` is a shared resource on OS process level.
   Additionally, fragmentation of the `HEAP` can lead to non-deterministic behavior of the application.
feat_req__persistency__dynamic_memory_al.title: Dynamic memory allocation during runtime

feat_req__persistency__fast_access.content: The Persistency shall ensure that random read access for key-value pair is completed with constant or logarithmic time complexity relative to the number of stored key-value pairs.
feat_req__persistency__fast_access.title: Random access time

feat_req__persistency__integrity_check.content: The Persistency shall detect and report data integrity issues.
feat_req__persistency__integrity_check.title: Integrity check

feat_req__persistency__load_data.content: The Persistency shall support loading of key-value pairs from persistent storage.
feat_req__persistency__load_data.title: Load persistent data

feat_req__persistency__multiple_app.content:
The Persistency shall prevent access to a single KVS instance from multiple OS processes.

.. note::
   Access from multiple OS processes violates freedom from interference, as applications can modify the same data concurrently.
feat_req__persistency__multiple_app.title: Access from multiple applications

feat_req__persistency__multiple_kvs.content: The Persistency shall support multiple independent storages per application.
feat_req__persistency__multiple_kvs.title: Multiple KVS per application

feat_req__persistency__os_agnostic.content: The Persistency shall be operating system agnostic.
feat_req__persistency__os_agnostic.title: Operating system agnostic implementation

feat_req__persistency__prod_mode.content:
The Persistency shall support the production mode.
The production mode should enforce the most restrictive data access controls feasible.
feat_req__persistency__prod_mode.title: Support production mode

feat_req__persistency__recovery_from_res.content:
The Persistency shall recover to a consistent state after reset.

.. note::
   After a reset, the Persistency shall ensure that all key-value pairs are in a consistent state, reflecting either the last successful write operation or the previous consistent state.
feat_req__persistency__recovery_from_res.title: Recovery from reset

feat_req__persistency__reset_resistant.content:
The Persistency shall ensure that write operations are reset resistant to prevent data corruption in case of expected or unexpected interruption.

.. note::
   As the constant power supply can not be guaranteed in embedded systems, it is essential to ensure that write operations are completed
   successfully, or rolled back to the previous state in case of any kind of interruption.
feat_req__persistency__reset_resistant.title: Reset resistant storage

feat_req__persistency__reset_to_default.content:
The Persistency shall support reset of individual key or all keys to their default values.
This is only applicable for existing keys that have a predefined default value.
feat_req__persistency__reset_to_default.title: Reset to default values

feat_req__persistency__snapshot_create.content:
The Persistency shall support explicit creation of snapshots. Snapshots are identified by unique IDs.
Snapshots shall also include the version of the data layout. See :need:`feat_req__persistency__versioning`.

.. note::
   Snapshots are point-in-time, read-only view on all key-value pairs at moment of snapshot creation. They are typically used for backup and rollback purposes.
   Implicit snapshots (e.g. created during store operation) shall be prevented to reduce storage consumption.
feat_req__persistency__snapshot_create.title: Snapshot create

feat_req__persistency__snapshot_remove.content: The Persistency shall support explicit removal of snapshots.
feat_req__persistency__snapshot_remove.title: Snapshot remove

feat_req__persistency__snapshot_restore.content: The Persistency shall support explicit restoration of snapshots.
feat_req__persistency__snapshot_restore.title: Snapshot restore

feat_req__persistency__storage_backends.content:
The Persistency shall support multiple storage backends.
More than one storage backend of the same type shall be optionally supported for the sake of redundancy.
The storage backends shall be compile time configurable for each KVS instance.

.. note::
   Storage backend represents an abstraction for the underlying storage format and mechanism.
   Configurable storage backends allow the user to select the most suitable solution for their specific use case (Performance, easy of use, resource consumption, ...).
feat_req__persistency__storage_backends.title: Multiple storage backends

feat_req__persistency__store_data.content: The Persistency shall support storing of key-value pairs to persistent storage.
feat_req__persistency__store_data.title: Store persistent data

feat_req__persistency__support_datatype_.content: The Persistency shall support UTF-8 encoded strings as valid key types.
feat_req__persistency__support_datatype_.title: Supported datatypes (Keys)

feat_req__persistency__support_datatype_.content: The Persistency shall support storing both primitive and non-primitive (composite) datatypes as values.
feat_req__persistency__support_datatype_.title: Supported datatypes (Values)

feat_req__persistency__tooling.content:
The Persistency shall provide tooling support for:

- viewing and modifying key-value pairs during development, testing and debugging
- provisioning of default values via external file
feat_req__persistency__tooling.title: Tooling

feat_req__persistency__update_mechanism.content: The Persistency shall implement mechanisms to upgrade from one version to another, including multi-version jumps.
feat_req__persistency__update_mechanism.title: Update Mechanism

feat_req__persistency__variant_managemen.content: The Persistency shall ensure compatibility across different SW versions.
feat_req__persistency__variant_managemen.title: Variant management support

feat_req__persistency__versioning.content:
The Persistency shall support versioning for different data representation of KVS.

.. note::
   Versioning is essential to ensure compatibility between different versions of the Persistency and the stored data.
   Each version shall be uniquely identifiable and include information of the data layout and structure.
feat_req__persistency__versioning.title: Versioning

feat_req__persistency__write_amplificati.content:
The Persistency shall minimize the write amplification during data storage operations to enhance performance and prolong the lifespan of the underlying storage medium.

.. note::
   Write amplification refers to the phenomenon where the amount of data written to the storage medium exceeds the amount of user data intended to be written.
   Minimizing write amplification is crucial for optimizing performance and reducing wear on storage devices, especially in embedded systems with limited number of program-erase cycles.
feat_req__persistency__write_amplificati.title: Write amplification minimization

feat_req__sec_crypt__access_control.content:
The security component shall support roles and capability rights management to enforce access
control to cryptographic functions and key material.
feat_req__sec_crypt__access_control.title: Access Control

feat_req__sec_crypt__algo_naming.content:
The security component shall use a uniform and unambiguous naming scheme for cryptographic
algorithms.
feat_req__sec_crypt__algo_naming.title: Standardized Algorithm Naming

feat_req__sec_crypt__algo_updates.content: The security component shall allow the updating of its cryptographic algorithms.
feat_req__sec_crypt__algo_updates.title: Crypto Algorithm Update Strategy

feat_req__sec_crypt__api_lifecycle.content:
The security component API shall provide clear mechanisms for initialization, context management
 (request, reuse, release), and de-initialization of cryptographic resources.
feat_req__sec_crypt__api_lifecycle.title: API Lifecycle Management

feat_req__sec_crypt__asym_algo_ecdh.content: The security component shall support the ECDH algorithm for key exchange.
feat_req__sec_crypt__asym_algo_ecdh.title: ECDH Support

feat_req__sec_crypt__asym_encryption.content: The security component shall provide functionality for asymmetric encryption and decryption.
feat_req__sec_crypt__asym_encryption.title: Asymmetric Encryption and Decryption

feat_req__sec_crypt__cert_management.content:
The security component shall provide functionality to manage a set of signed and verified
(trusted) certificates.
feat_req__sec_crypt__cert_management.title: Certificate Management

feat_req__sec_crypt__dos_mitigation.content:
The security component shall incorporate measures to mitigate the risk of Denial-of-Service
(DoS) attacks that could be caused by malicious messages creating exceptional computational
load.
feat_req__sec_crypt__dos_mitigation.title: Denial-of-Service (DoS) Mitigation

feat_req__sec_crypt__error_handling.content:
The security component shall provide a structured and consistent mechanism for error reporting
and logging.
feat_req__sec_crypt__error_handling.title: Structured Error Handling

feat_req__sec_crypt__flexible_api.content:
The API of the security component shall allow a selection of the available
algorithms based on their unique name.
feat_req__sec_crypt__flexible_api.title: API to allow selection of different algorithms

feat_req__sec_crypt__hashing.content: The security component shall provide hashing functionality.
feat_req__sec_crypt__hashing.title: Hashing Functionality

feat_req__sec_crypt__hashing_algo_sha2.content: The security component shall support the SHA-2 hashing algorithm.
feat_req__sec_crypt__hashing_algo_sha2.title: SHA-2 Support

feat_req__sec_crypt__hashing_algo_sha3.content: The security component shall support the SHA-3 hashing algorithm.
feat_req__sec_crypt__hashing_algo_sha3.title: SHA-3 Support

feat_req__sec_crypt__hw_acceleration.content:
The security component shall be able to rely on hardware acceleration for cryptographic
operations.
feat_req__sec_crypt__hw_acceleration.title: Hardware Acceleration Support

feat_req__sec_crypt__ids_integration.content:
The security component shall provide a mechanism to report potential security anomalies or
threats to an Intrusion Detection System (IDS).
feat_req__sec_crypt__ids_integration.title: Intrusion Detection System (IDS) Integration

feat_req__sec_crypt__kdf.content:
The security component shall provide Key Derivation Functions (KDFs) to derive one or more
secret keys from a master key or password.
feat_req__sec_crypt__kdf.title: Key Derivation

feat_req__sec_crypt__key_deletion.content: The security component shall support the secure deletion of key material.
feat_req__sec_crypt__key_deletion.title: Secure Key Deletion

feat_req__sec_crypt__key_generation.content: The security component shall support the secure generation of key material.
feat_req__sec_crypt__key_generation.title: Secure Key Generation

feat_req__sec_crypt__key_import.content: The security component shall support the secure import of key material.
feat_req__sec_crypt__key_import.title: Secure Key Import

feat_req__sec_crypt__key_storage.content: The security component shall support the secure storage of key material.
feat_req__sec_crypt__key_storage.title: Secure Key Storage

feat_req__sec_crypt__mac.content:
The security component shall provide functionality for Message Authentication Codes (MAC) to
ensure message integrity and authenticity.
feat_req__sec_crypt__mac.title: Message Authentication Code

feat_req__sec_crypt__no_key_exposure.content: The API of the security component shall not reveal key material to its users.
feat_req__sec_crypt__no_key_exposure.title: No Key Material Exposure

feat_req__sec_crypt__os_protection.content:
The security component shall use system-level means (e.g., co-processor, HSM, TEE) to protect
its memory and CPU from applications and the normal operating system.
feat_req__sec_crypt__os_protection.title: OS-Level Protection

feat_req__sec_crypt__performance_tooling.content:
The security component shall contain a set of extendable benchmark tests to derive KPIs from
running all it's cryptographic operations on different systems.
feat_req__sec_crypt__performance_tooling.title: Performance benchmark tooling

feat_req__sec_crypt__pqc_readiness.content: The security component shall be designed to be ready for post-quantum cryptography.
feat_req__sec_crypt__pqc_readiness.title: Post-Quantum Readiness

feat_req__sec_crypt__production_keys.content:
The security component shall consider the production scenario where initial production keys are
brought into the system.
feat_req__sec_crypt__production_keys.title: Initial Production Key Handling

feat_req__sec_crypt__reverse_eng_protect.content: The security component shall withstand reverse engineering of its secrets.
feat_req__sec_crypt__reverse_eng_protect.title: Reverse Engineering Protection

feat_req__sec_crypt__rng.content: The security component shall provide a source of entropy for random number generation.
feat_req__sec_crypt__rng.title: Entropy Source

feat_req__sec_crypt__rng_algo_chacha20rn.content: The security component shall use the ChaCha20Rng algorithm for random number generation.
feat_req__sec_crypt__rng_algo_chacha20rn.title: ChaCha20Rng Support

feat_req__sec_crypt__security_concept.content:
A security concept shall be created for the security component, including security goals,
plausible attacks, critical failures, and countermeasures.
feat_req__sec_crypt__security_concept.title: Security Concept

feat_req__sec_crypt__side_channel_mitiga.content: The security component shall be designed to mitigate side-channel and timing attacks.
feat_req__sec_crypt__side_channel_mitiga.title: Side-Channel Attack Mitigation

feat_req__sec_crypt__sig_algo_ecdsa.content: The security component shall support the ECDSA algorithm for digital signatures.
feat_req__sec_crypt__sig_algo_ecdsa.title: ECDSA Support

feat_req__sec_crypt__sig_creation.content: The security component shall provide functionality to create digital signatures.
feat_req__sec_crypt__sig_creation.title: Signature Creation

feat_req__sec_crypt__sig_verification.content: The security component shall provide functionality to verify digital signatures.
feat_req__sec_crypt__sig_verification.title: Signature Verification

feat_req__sec_crypt__sw_fallback.content: A software-only solution for cryptographic operations shall be available as a fallback.
feat_req__sec_crypt__sw_fallback.title: Software Fallback

feat_req__sec_crypt__sym_algo_chacha20.content: The security component shall support the ChaCha20-Poly1305 symmetric encryption algorithm.
feat_req__sec_crypt__sym_algo_chacha20.title: ChaCha20-Poly1305 Support

feat_req__sec_crypt__sym_sym_algo_aes_cc.content: The security component shall support the AES-CCM symmetric encryption algorithm.
feat_req__sec_crypt__sym_sym_algo_aes_cc.title: AES-CCM Support

feat_req__sec_crypt__sym_sym_algo_aes_gc.content: The security component shall support the AES-GCM symmetric encryption algorithm.
feat_req__sec_crypt__sym_sym_algo_aes_gc.title: AES-GCM Support

feat_req__sec_crypt__sym_symm_algo_aes_c.content: The security component shall support the AES-CBC symmetric encryption algorithm.
feat_req__sec_crypt__sym_symm_algo_aes_c.title: AES-CBC Support

feat_req__sec_crypt__sym_symmetric_encry.content: The security component shall provide functionality for symmetric encryption and decryption.
feat_req__sec_crypt__sym_symmetric_encry.title: Symmetric Encryption and Decryption

feat_req__sec_crypt__tls_support.content:
The security component shall support the Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.3 protocol for secure
communication over Ethernet.
feat_req__sec_crypt__tls_support.title: TLS Support

feat_req__sec_crypt__trusted_time.content: The security component shall have access to a trusted real-world wall clock.
feat_req__sec_crypt__trusted_time.title: Trusted Time Source

feat_req__some_ip_gateway__e2e_plugin_if.content: The SOME/IP Gateway shall support an interface to plug-in a E2E protection service implementation.
feat_req__some_ip_gateway__e2e_plugin_if.title: Plug-In-IFC for End-to-End protection modules

feat_req__some_ip_gateway__e2e_specs.content: The E2E protection implementation shall be fully compatible and complying with the E2E protocol specification from `some-ip.com <https://some-ip.com/>`_.
feat_req__some_ip_gateway__e2e_specs.title: Compatibility with `some-ip.com <https://some-ip.com/>`_ E2E Protocol Specification

feat_req__some_ip_gateway__someip_protoc.content: The SOME/IP protocol implementation shall be fully compatible and complying with the SOME/IP protocol specification from `some-ip.com <https://some-ip.com/>`_.
feat_req__some_ip_gateway__someip_protoc.title: Compatibility with `some-ip.com <https://some-ip.com/>`_ Protocol Specification

feat_req__some_ip_gateway__someip_sd_pro.content: The Service Discovery implementation shall be fully compatible and complying with the SOME/IP service discovery specification from `some-ip.com <https://some-ip.com/>`_.
feat_req__some_ip_gateway__someip_sd_pro.title: Compatibility with `some-ip.com <https://some-ip.com/>`_ SOME/IP Service Discovery Protocol Specification

feat_req__some_ip_gateway__stack_plugin_.content: The SOME/IP Gateway shall support an interface to plug-in a SOME/IP stack implementation.
feat_req__some_ip_gateway__stack_plugin_.title: Plug-In-IFC for SOME/IP protocol stacks

feat_req__time__abs_acc_qual.content:
The **score::time feature** shall provide an API to read accuracy qualifier of the absolute time base, synchronized to external time sources.

Note: the inaccuracy could be indicated in the following manner

* Inaccuracy higher than 24h
* Inaccuracy less than 24h
* Inaccuracy less than 1h
* Inaccuracy less than 15min
* Inaccuracy less than 60s
* Inaccuracy less than 10s
* Inaccuracy less than 1s
* Inaccuracy less than 500ms
* Inaccuracy less than 100ms
* Inaccuracy less than 50ms
* Inaccuracy less than 10ms
* Inaccuracy not available
feat_req__time__abs_acc_qual.section_name: Time Synchronization to absolute external sources
sections: Time Synchronization to absolute external sources
feat_req__time__abs_acc_qual.title: Absolute Time base accuracy qualifier

feat_req__time__abs_base_api.content: The **score::time feature** shall provide an API to read the absolute time base, synchronized to external time sources.
feat_req__time__abs_base_api.section_name: Time Synchronization to absolute external sources
sections: Time Synchronization to absolute external sources
feat_req__time__abs_base_api.title: Absolute Time base API

feat_req__time__abs_sec_qual.content:
The **score::time feature** shall provide an API to read security qualifier of the absolute time base, synchronized to external time sources.

Note: the security level might be indicated in the following steps
